question:
Which one of the following statements is *true* about the oxacyclohexane conformer of the sugar $\beta$-D-(+)-glucopyranose?

**(a)** One $\ce{OH}$ group is axial, but all remaining substituents are equatorial. **(b)** The $\ce{CH_2OH}$ group is axial, but all remaining groups are equatorial. **(c)** All groups are axial. **(d)** All groups are equatorial.
